    • Constructor Detail

      • Hangman

        Hangman(List<String> dictionary,
        int length,
        int max)
 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets up a hangman game. It chooses a word from the list given with a length that matches the length given.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - a list of non-empty strings containing only lower-case charactesrs
        length - the length of the word to choose
        max - the max number of missed guesses allowed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the length is less than 1

    • Method Detail

                                                       int length)
                                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates the set of words from the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - of list of non-empty strings containing lower-case letters
        length - the desired word length
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the desired length is less than 1

      • record

        public int record(char guess)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: HangmanManager
        Record state changes based on new letter guess.
        Specified by:
        record in interface HangmanManager
        Parameters:
        guess - the letter being guessed [Precondition: must be lower-case letter] [Precondition: must not be among letters already guessed]
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the guessed letter in the goal
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if letter is already guessed
        See Also:
        HangmanManager.record(char)
